meanings.sent1: After the storm, the river will reflood the fields.
meanings.sent2: The dam broke, causing the area to reflood with water.
meanings.sent3: The bathtub decided to reflood itself just as I finished draining it.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions reflooded her heart when she saw the old photograph.
meanings.sent5: The memories of the past reflooded his mind, overwhelming him with nostalgia.

meanings.definition: To fill or cover with water again.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain will reflood the streets if the drains are blocked.
meanings.sent2: The burst pipe caused the basement to reflood with water.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy managed to reflood the dry bathtub with splashes.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter reflooded the room, bringing joy to everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The tears reflooded her eyes as she listened to the touching story.
